website_summaries.verdict: A stainless-steel apple corer that leaves you with neat apple slices too.
pros: Just push down and you have your apple cored and wedged, ready for easy eating
Has more blades to make more wedges than other similar apple corer, slicer models
cons: The extra blades create a little more resistance requiring more force to push this slicer down

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our fruit pie queen
customer_reviews.text: Our teenage daughter holds an epic bake sale for charity every summer. This year, we baked 20 fruit pies. Just before we were in the throes of baking, I mentioned to my husband that the apple chopper was about to break (plastic handles) and would not survive the coming baking storm. He purchased this chopper for her. It's nice and sharp and very study. It made bake sale season just a little easier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid long lasting build
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to buy one of these disposable slicers. I have bought many from the local stores and they last about 3 months max. At that point the plastic breaks, blades rust or the whole thing basically falls apart. I was willing to pay a bit more, but wasn't going to get ripped by outfits like Pampered Chef, etc... This was perfect. I like the 12 slices instead of the 8 I was seeing around Amazon. I don't have to dislocate my jaw to eat a slice and coworkers don't have to wait 5 minutes while I chew if they have a question! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Large apples need a large slicer
customer_reviews.text: I really like this apple slicer it is the third one I bought the first two are identical but this one's larger I had bought some apples and they were too big to use with the existing slicer that I have so I had to cut them by hand I went looking and found this one which is larger and works great
customer_reviews.author: Reading maniac

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty construction. Sharp cutting blades. Need to exert sufficient pressure to initiate cut...important to keep tool level with even pressure while slightly rocking tool left and right instead of direct downward pressure. Cutting is even a precise. I use it for apples and pears. This tool presents a large diameter cutting area however it is a good to insure apples, etc. are not "super sized". It will be interesting to learn the effective life of the cutting blades as a practical way to sharpen does not appear to be an option. Nonetheless this tool appears to be good value for the money as opposed to other less expensive knock-offs.
customer_reviews.author: Retiredman1

customer_reviews.title: Excellent apple/pear tool
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tool after an earlier tool broke. This item is much more sturdy, very sharp. You should know it slices segments into small pieces, perfect for children and people with swallowing problems. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ron F.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: For a little 10 dollar item, this thing works great! Very easy to use, blades are sharp, and it cuts apples, pears and other fruits perfectly. You can really make a nice presentation with guests. Buy one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, well-built.
customer_reviews.text: This apple slicer is wonderful. It can easily slice the largest apples. It's made of entirely of steel, and is very sturdy. It's very easy to get 12 slices within just a few seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Frank G. Pratt III

customer_reviews.title: Broke apart during normal use
customer_reviews.text: After using this kitchen gadget for about a month, it broke into three pieces. Normal use, nothing heavy. I sent an email to the vendor, no response. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Nice Large Slicer
customer_reviews.text: This works very good at coring and dividing the larger apples. There is no coating on the handles, which makes it a little uncomfortable to use - but it does a very good job
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, sharp, strong, apple corer and I'm pretty pleased with it. But, I wish it made slices that were a little thinner. Also, it's hard to get the corer all the way to the bottom of the apple. That means, a little bit of uncut skin and apple remain on the bottom of the corer which means it's a little bit hard to get the slices off the device and the remaining bits of apple are a little bit hard to clean off it when you're done. These are minor inconveniences though.
customer_reviews.author: Abbie

customer_reviews.title: Too flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I was able to slice two apples but on the third, the metal slicing part broke and got stuck in the apple. Get an all metal model - this plastic one is not sturdy enough.
customer_reviews.author: Pat C

customer_reviews.title: cheaply made and falls apart
customer_reviews.text: This fell apart in my hands after using about 4 months after I owned it. I reached out to the company and they never responded. I wouldn't buy it if I were you.
customer_reviews.author: David McNulty

customer_reviews.title: It’s not at all sharp.
customer_reviews.text: It’s not sharp at all. I got to the halfway point in the apple and had to pound several times to get it to go all the way through. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: S. Crawford

customer_reviews.title: great slicer
customer_reviews.text: This is a basic no frills slicer, but it is sturdy and gets the job done. I like that it has more than 6 slices, less cutting for me to do when making an apple pie. I have broken 2 of the plastic handled slicers, and this one is all metal. Be careful the handles can get a little slippery after a lot of slicing, having a towel nearby is helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Red Sox fan

customer_reviews.title: Good investment
customer_reviews.text: Very nice Apple cutter! Some reviewers said it wasn’t good for larger Apples, I would disagree, it works just fine for larger apples the diameter of the cutting blades is the same as other Apple cutters. The center is NOT noticeably an smaller then others either. The blades are very sharp! Due to the sharpness it is harder to clean but not impossible. The build is sturdy. The size of slices are perfect for pie filling and for snacking. The center does not waste much flesh on very large apples you may not get all the core (but that was the same with other corer)
customer_reviews.author: SAHM Family

customer_reviews.title: Bigger and better
customer_reviews.text: Love it, bigger than my other one and I love the smaller slices.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The fruit slicing whiz
customer_reviews.text: Ive broken a few plastic slicers in the past so I chose this metal slicer to be more robust. All these slicers have a weak point where all of the thin blades gather. The blades will flex and can break if too much force is used, this I learned using plastic slicers in the past. A firm fruit can be a bit tough to get started due to multiple points of contact, but once the sharp blades dig in its child's play to cut up. Ive been though a few dozen apples with 0 issues so far. A good upgrade over similar plastic slicers.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Very fancy upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: I eat an apple almost every morning for breakfast and I had an old apple cutter without sharp blades. I would cut my apple, then rinse it off with super hot water, bang it on my hand to shake the water off and then let it dry for tomorrow morning... Welp this stainless steel apple cutter has got some weight to it! I did that with this one and got some cuts on my hand because I didnt realize this one has blades! Lol... very odd realization moment for me. Anyway... it cuts apples very well and I think it will last for a long while since my old one was far cheaper and lasted for years.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Cross

customer_reviews.title: Great product until it broke
customer_reviews.text: I liked the sturdiness and size of this product. It had very sharp blades and fairly easily cut through large Gala apples, although not always all the way through. However, in just about 6 months the blades came loose while slicing a small apple. Fortunately it barely missed slicing my fingers or worse. Probably the secret is that if the slicing is too hard, don't try to put too much pressure on it and instead just use a knife to slice. It would be a lot safer. I think I am going to try the Amazon choice selection and work with that instead. Don't want to risk any more "surprises."
customer_reviews.author: EJA

customer_reviews.title: Agree with others, it is super sharp.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my parents who had an ancient one that finally gave up it’s ghost. They appreciate how ergonomic the handles and how sharp the blades are as they are older and don’t have the strength that they used to. It is also nice that it makes more, and therefore smaller, slices. Overall very please with the product. As others have said, it is larger and can handle larger apples.
customer_reviews.author: KmbHdcz

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE PRODUCT CAUSES SEVERE LACERATION
customer_reviews.text: This product is not only a piece of junk it is dangerous too. I used about a dozen times and it completely fell apart while slicing an apple causing a severe laceration on my hand. It is a VERY DANGEROUS product. Avoid at all costs
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Millman

customer_reviews.title: Too Big, Too  Heavy, Too Sharp
customer_reviews.text: This thing scares me a bit. It is super sharp, probably more than it needs to be to cut apples; you can easily cut yourself if you are not careful. It is also a bit of a monstrosity for an apple cutter. Have to be careful placing it in the dishwasher or it could easily cut the coating on the racks; and if you place it upside down as this demands you have to be careful not to reach for it after the wash is done or you could easily cut yourself. Doesn't rust but that doesn't outweigh the fact that I don't think it is very safe for everyday use. I wouldn't want this around kids.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Awful.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Broke within days of receiving and was not sharp or that effective.
customer_reviews.author: EGB

customer_reviews.title: Second apple corer & the best out there!
customer_reviews.text: Sick of the plastic handle breaking on your current apple corer? If so, this is for you. Our first one lasted a few years & then broke after a lot of use. Without hesitation, I purchased another. You won't find a better apple corer!
customer_reviews.author: Karl & Jessica S.

customer_reviews.title: Super, well designed apple slicer!
customer_reviews.text: It is a wonderful addition. The handles make it secure and the blades do a great job in neatly slicing even the hardest apple. It cleans very easily and the enclosed thoughtfully added brush is barely needed. The core extracts neatly. I just made a compote of tart cherry juice and lots of apple slices; simmered it for a while and enjoyed it later!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Bobby

customer_reviews.title: I looked at a bunch of slicers. I do not regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I looked at a ton of apple slices on Amazon and the internet. Lots of them seem to break quick, rust up or stop slicing. So far this one has been great for me! I am consistently transporting it in lunch bag with apples and other things with no issue. Always cuts, cleans easy, no sign or rust or wear and tear. So far i am impressed and feel i will get my monies worth. I will recommend to all and buy again if the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Apple corer
customer_reviews.text: Not sharp enough to slice through an apple have to press down and smack it on the counter to cut through
customer_reviews.author: Drucille Conrad

customer_reviews.title: Minus one star because I sliced my finger on it
customer_reviews.text: This thing is sharp AF. One complaint I have is that the "frame" of the slicer comes down a little lower than the blades, so it doesn't cut all the way through the apple so you kind of have to pull up on the apple or tear off the last little bit to get individual slices. Other than that, it is sturdy and, like I said, super sharp. Comes with a little cleaning brush, which was a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: SeaCactus

customer_reviews.title: What a terrific slicer!
customer_reviews.text: This is an incredible slicer/corer. Strong, sharp (careful!!) and comes with its own miniature bottle brush for safe cleaning. Our last one broke - not sure if it was misused, or simply not up to the task - a guest broke it. This one will NOT break - it's a little wider than our old one, stronger than our old one, and sharper than our old one. Sometimes, with some of the larger varietals (like the Stayman Winesaps) the old corer wouldn't work so well. No concerns with this one at all! And the suggestions for use on other fruits and vegetables - well, I am looking forward to trying this to make potato wedges VERY quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Catherin A. Gumpert Chen

customer_reviews.title: NOT STAINLESS STEEL
customer_reviews.text: Only giving this item a one star because this is NOT STAINLESS STEEL! I tried to hang it on my magnetic knife holder and this item is aluminum! Very disappointed to pay $15 for a false advertisement.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra

customer_reviews.title: Super strong for these apples that just keep getting bigger and bigger
customer_reviews.text: So we all know our apples are not normal...they seem to get bigger and bigger. My previous apple slicer was great for "normal" apples. However, my daughter's friend broke it because it had plastic handles. So, I purchased this little guy. So glad I did as this one is much stronger and can take on super apples! Very happy with this product and strongly encourage you to purchase one. As you can tell by the pictures, it's definitely a good product!
customer_reviews.author: Primeshopfam

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous! Severe cut after blades broke loose
customer_reviews.text: Dangerous! Do not buy. During the second use, the circle of blades broke off the handles and severely cut my hand. A regular Granny Smith Apple was enough to bend the blades. This thing should be recalled or no longer sold.
customer_reviews.author: reddirtdarling

customer_reviews.title: SHARP
customer_reviews.text: Very, very sharp. I use a knife or fork to push the apple through the holes, because I used my finger the first time and ended up with one of those skin deep cuts that bleed forever. Nice and heavy, slices well, just chuck it in the dishwasher. I like it a lot, just be careful not to cut yourself. (I've never met an apple slicer that went all the way through the fruit so you don't have to push the core and slices out, so I don't expect that and you probably shouldn't either).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Large Slicer/Corer
customer_reviews.text: Seems well made, decent value and it's sharp. Arrived yesterday and it's already sliced several apples, that's common in these parts (this house). Don't know that it's easier to clean than any of the others out there, after all it has blades so there's risk, use common sense and you'll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Opaliski

customer_reviews.title: Wish there was a better slicer type than this one.
customer_reviews.text: I have to pound it down hard to get it through the apple. I tried to find a different type but there isn't another kind.how dissappointing. When I finally get it through the apple, it slices good. I put down a bath towel folded many times to make a buffer then slam the slicer on the apple on the padded counter. I have to often cut the core out of the slicer because it doesn't come out easily.
customer_reviews.author: Paulette E

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy, Very Sharp
customer_reviews.text: The only think I didn't like about this corer is that the core circle part is a little small and it's a bit hard to push thru an apple. I've had ones in the past that are easier to use but they also didn't cut as many apple slices. I like this one for the sturdy construction, cuts a lot of pieces at once, and it is very very sharp. Be careful your first time washing it - the blades are sharp!
customer_reviews.author: A. Pulido

customer_reviews.title: Not as sharp as the OXO slicer, but like the extra slices it makes
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace our oxo 8 slicer after 10 years and countless apples because it didn't seem as sharp anymore. I saw this one and liked that it made 12 slices and had excellent reviews. Unfortunately it is harder to push through apples than my old Oxo! Keeping it because I prefer the 12 slices. We've only used it a few times so far so I can't speak for the durability, but it doesn't feel flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Monika L.

customer_reviews.title: Go with the all metal - much better
customer_reviews.text: Great item, very sturdy and large capacity for big apples. Super sharp - seriously - be careful. We had several other big name brands that had plastic handles and they kept breaking and then end up in a landfill. This one is all metal and if and when it does wear out - which will be a long time - it can be recycled in metal. Best one we have found to date.
customer_reviews.author: MartyJoe

customer_reviews.title: Great Apple Slicer
customer_reviews.text: I really like how sturdy the slicer is, and have used it several times now for pies. Perfect size slices every time
customer_reviews.author: Ann Boroughs

customer_reviews.title: Works great- easy to clean too
customer_reviews.text: I used the included peeler to make applesauce, the put apple through slicer. Easy! On a huge Granny Smirh, I used a rubber hammer to pound it through the slicer, as I often use a rubber mallet on top of a knife to cut through yams or spaghetti squash. The Apple peeler included works well, and the little brush makes it easy to clean the slicer.
customer_reviews.author: Connecticut Reader

customer_reviews.title: Blades are VERY Sharp
customer_reviews.text: Easily slices through apples with no flex or give. Once an apple has been sliced, just press gently downward on the slices and they easily drop from the bottom of the slicer. Then just pull the core up and out. As mentioned, the blades are very sharp so exercise caution when cleaning the blades. All I do is just rinse with hot water.
customer_reviews.author: dglockster

customer_reviews.title: SHARP
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best apple slicer I've ever had. Once you break through the apple's skin though, get your fingers out of the way when you press down because this baby is super sharp. And store it with sharp side facing away from hand reach. I like that it cuts more slices than most slicers. You feel like you're getting more apple!
customer_reviews.author: Encie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, but no blade guard
customer_reviews.text: It's an awesome product, and I'd give it 5 stars, but it doesn't come with a blast guard! What's that all about?? 6 razor sharp blades, plus they are slightly lower than the body, so they come into contact with all surfaces you place it on (scratching the surfaces and dulling the blades), and this is usually an item that people with kids buy, and no blade guard?? So I made my own. Other than that, it's great; love it!
customer_reviews.author: NYGuy

customer_reviews.title: Stainless Steel - Why do I have rust on the cutting blades ?
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Apple slicer for its sturdiness and the fact that it is advertised as being made from high quality Stainless Steel. after a year of use, I now see rust on the cutting blades close to the center. Shocking - good quality stainless steel should not rust ever !
customer_reviews.author: N.R.Dev

customer_reviews.title: We needed this
customer_reviews.text: This was an upgrade. We had a plastic one that started to crack on one of the handles. It wasn't safe to use and we use this almost every day. This version is sturdy. It's also larger than the last one. With the plastic one, sometimes I would have to cut the sides of a larger apple to make it fit. Not with this one. Larger apples fit!
customer_reviews.author: PWDeckerTop Contributor: Power Rangers

customer_reviews.title: Get this if you have kids that slam down apples
customer_reviews.text: We have burned through two plastic slicers due to the handle breaking. Metal is a hell of a lot better I even if it’s low grade. Slicing an apple with a broken plastic handle is quick dangerous so this metal one is much better. This one has a nice mix of affordability and durability. With the premium for me at least but my kids eat two apples a day usually.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron M

customer_reviews.title: Top notch product in every way!
customer_reviews.text: Oh how I love this. The one I had before ( different brand) had blunt dull blades that was really hard to use it required so much force to use. This ones cutters are very sharp making a big difference in amount of effort needed. Also big plus it works on really big apples. Very well made and super sturdy. Perfect in every way for me.
customer_reviews.author: 30rock1

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a beast and I love it
customer_reviews.text: So I accidentally broke the last slicer I had in half so this time around I wanted to get something a little less delicate and this was a damn good buy. And all the apples I cut now are so clean and elegant somehow? Either way I feel like I can put my whole body into this thing and itll keep doing its job without worrying about possible damage.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaly

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I liked that it made cutting/coring apples easy and quick. "Easy" got a four because it does require some pressure, but that's to be expected due to the number of slices it produces. Ideal would be a lever attached to the top of the tool to provide some leverage. I found that slicing off a bit of the bottom of the apple made things easier since the apple didn't tend to tilt so much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty and Sharp
customer_reviews.text: This tool really does the trick. It's heavy duty and makes slicing apples a snap. Not so easy to clean but none of them are. Be careful to put it in the drawer with the cutting side down. It is very sharp... as it should be. Seems to be very quality materials. Heavy and no signs of corrosion after lots of use.
customer_reviews.author: Rick C.

customer_reviews.title: Not a benefit to the task; not recommended
customer_reviews.text: A very dull instrument that does not easily pass through apple. Does not cleanly cut through the peel, leaving the need for a knife to finish.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Time saver
customer_reviews.text: This is fairly easy to use but does take some maneuvering and force to cleanly and evenly slice the apple. My kids dont feel comfortable using it by themselves, but it does save me enough time to still be useful. The build is sturdy enough for light use. I've found no rust in the last 3 ish months of use and cleaning up is quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Snerdy

customer_reviews.title: This looks great but the build quality is very poor!
customer_reviews.text: This looks great but the build quality is very poor. After just a couple of months, the welds gave lose; the welds that hold the blades to the inner hub are weak! They break and the entire device is no good anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R. Dinwiddie

customer_reviews.title: Very solid and precise.
customer_reviews.text: This apple slicer is very solidly built. I like Fuji apples, which are fairly crisp. I always use a cutting board and press the slicer down firmly over the apple. I have not had an apple that was too big for it to handle. The brush that comes with it helps to remove apple fragments from the slicer. But then a trip through the dishwasher, and it's ready to go again.
customer_reviews.author: J Michael Strange

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: I sent this to a friend as she likes to eat apples and thought she would enjoy it. Unfortunately she tried it a few times and was never able to get it through an apple. I don’t know if she stuck it in her drawer or if she threw it out. I feel like I wasted my money
customer_reviews.author: M. Hans

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy/durable
customer_reviews.text: This apple corer/slicer is no comparison to the big box store type.. this will not bend as you punch it thru the fruit. The bottom is ALMOST razor sharp, so be VERY cautious.. almost sliced myself when I took it out of the box! This will not disappoint and will last years.
customer_reviews.author: donna

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, sharp, and does the job well.
customer_reviews.text: Got this Apple slice after having another of the plastic ones break. Sturdy, sharp, and does the job well. If you’re worried about cutting your fingers like some reviewers, used something like a wooden kitchen spoon to push the last bits through if the apple is a shape that leaves uncut bits at the bottom. 5 stars. My only comment is I wish they offered a set with one cutting thin slices like this one which is perfect for a fruit and cheese plate, and a second one that cuts thicker slices for adult snacks or lunches.
customer_reviews.author: Moi

customer_reviews.title: Good slicer but doesn’t go through all the way
customer_reviews.text: We eat honesycrisp apples. They are large so I ordered this slicer. I’m really happy with the size of the slicer. However, it doesn’t get all the way through the Apple. There’s nothing to help push the apple slices off so it stays connected at the core.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Would not cut apple.
customer_reviews.text: This was so dull that I actually looked at both sides thinking I was doing it wrong. Nope! Just poor product...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to reduce apples, pears to perfect slices
customer_reviews.text: This is much sturdier than the part plastic slicer I was using before. I'm short and had to put my full weight on the previous cutter to get through an apple. This is far easier to use. The thinner slices are perfect for pie or a young child's hands. Use it nearly every day.
customer_reviews.author: Susan P. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Made a blooming onion
customer_reviews.text: didn't cut all the way through at the bottom, tried on many flat surfaces, left feeling like a blooming onion
customer_reviews.author: Michael G. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Works great but
customer_reviews.text: If you don’t have a dishwasher, it’s hard to clean. Best thing I found was to warsh it asap. Yes I warsh my stuff. Besides it drives kids crazy. Especially when I say, can you get the warsh out of the washer(no R). They always ask how I can say one with a R?lol
customer_reviews.author: Ken Mullikin

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one week
customer_reviews.text: Decent enough slicer. It does the job as any slicer would. Blades are sharp enough without being dangerous. Only problem is it started falling apart after about 5 uses. Fortunately, Amazon has a good return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Occasionally Honest

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp
customer_reviews.text: This cutter is very durable and quite heavy duty. It can really cut a finger or other limb because it is so sharp. Be careful. I use an old toothbrush to clean the blades.
customer_reviews.author: Hoosiermom

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This works, although my small wife really has to put alot into it, poor thing, not their fault she's just tiny. She loves it and it make easy work of dispensing an apple and getting it into our mouths. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Nitram

customer_reviews.title: It cuts better than any slicer I've owned.
customer_reviews.text: The SAVORLIVING Apple Slicer 12-Blade Extra Large Apple Corer, Stainless Steel Ultra-Sharp Apple Cutter works as well as advertised. I have not had a moment's trouble. It cuts apples better than any cutter I've ever had. My diet calls for 1/2 fruit in the morning and 1/2 in the evening, and I save half the apple in the fridge. The cutter is great for that. But watch your fingers! It's sharp! I don't recommend pushing the slices out, pull them.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas N. Chambless

customer_reviews.title: Great product, just as great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to slice apples for my children. It worked very well and fit very large apples. I also liked that it cut the apples into 12 pieces instead of 8. After about 6 months of use the product broke. We were extremely disappointed as it was our go to slicer for apples and pears. I contacted Savorliving through email and they told me they would send a new product to replace the broken one. I'm not only impressed with this company's product, but with our customer service as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is THE thickest apple slicer I've ever seen. I've broke 4 over the years so decided to go metal this time. Use a cutting board underneath to protect your counter. Love that it slices into 12 instead of 8.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Stone

customer_reviews.title: Slices all the way thru the apple!
customer_reviews.text: I've had several apple slicers and this one is the best. It's sturdy and built to cut all the way thru instead of requiring a lot of twisting and grinding to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Country Boy

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have huge HoneyCrisp Apples and no apple cutter could fit them to cut. I love this one so much! I got one given to me, and I bought this for a friend at work for out huge apples. Both very happy campers!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie M

customer_reviews.title: Not sure how I lived without this before
customer_reviews.text: Sharp cuts apple perfectly large or small, perfect little thing. I love it. you will too. I recommend getting this one as it makes perfect pieces for pies. or eating
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: The product is very sturdy and slices the apple into nice size pieces. Easy to clean, just put a little soap and water in a bowl and let it sit for a while then rinse off and air dry. I then put it back in the box that it came in so no one inadvertently cuts themselves in a drawer full of kitchen gadgets.
customer_reviews.author: Onthe Banks

customer_reviews.title: Super sharp!  Easily slices apples!
customer_reviews.text: We love this apple slicer! The only thing that would make it better is a protective guard for storing in the kitchen drawer. It is SUPER sharp, which is great for apple slicing, but not so much for little fingers. Proper storage is key!
customer_reviews.author: kristine_paulowski

customer_reviews.title: Effortless Cutting of the Largest Apples
customer_reviews.text: This is a very high quality, surgical-steel grade appliance. It is VERY sharp and cuts very well...just be sure to keep you fingers off the razor sharp edges during cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen G  Tartaglia

customer_reviews.title: Nice Corer!
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with this corer, which works great for slicing apples, pears, and potatoes (so far). I am not sure why the product box says that problems can occur if one doesn't properly clean and dry this corer after use, so that is my only beef. (My other corers just self-dry or go into a dishwasher.) I do like the 12 slices as opposed to 8.
customer_reviews.author: Leslee J. Klinsky

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy with multiple partitions
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that this apple slicer has more partitions which gives smaller slices. Since it is metal it is sturdier. The slicers I have had before were part plastic and eventually broke.
customer_reviews.author: EsJ

customer_reviews.title: Built to last
customer_reviews.text: Compared to the name-brand 8-slice cutter I have, it is more precisely and solidly built. It seems sharper, too, based on the effort required. I need to check if they make other configurations.
customer_reviews.author: Pieter B

customer_reviews.title: Feels heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: I broke my other brand one, the one with the grey bottom flap to push the apple up. It cracked... This one goes through apples like butter haha. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: R. Morsy

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. My 10 year old sliver with a broken piece of plastic still cuts apples better than this one
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Easier than a knife.
customer_reviews.text: It’s hard to get the cut started, you really have to press heavily. It doesn’t cut all the way through, you have to pull the cut pieces off.easier
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: Best Apple Cutter
customer_reviews.text: Bought theirs because we kept breaking Apple cutters. Be careful this thing is super sharp & will cut you. I love how it come with a small brush to clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Zahra Amiri

customer_reviews.title: Not stainless steel
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this apple slicer a few days ago. Bought it because if the great reviews. After using it once, I noticed it is not stainless steel but I fact, copper with a chrome plating. I will be returning it because it is not the quality material specified in the description.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Glogovsky

customer_reviews.title: SHARP CUT APPLES
customer_reviews.text: Love it! So far the best. I have used it every day several months now. It’s SHARP! I read some said it broke, it appears to be re designed. I paid far more for one at a kitchen store that broke in 6 mo. So I’m thrilled !!!
customer_reviews.author: LadyVal

customer_reviews.title: Solid and Sharp
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Should last many years. "Tall" handles make it easier to use. Cleaning brush that comes with it it is an added plus. Slice size is just what we prefer.
customer_reviews.author: Martin H JacobyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Well designed and sturdy Apple Slicer
customer_reviews.text: I use an apple slicer almost daily and many are just to flimsy or not sharp, or do not stay sharp. This one is great and can go into the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Lulu

customer_reviews.title: It cuts well through apples
customer_reviews.text: I liked that it was sharp enough to push through the apples fairly easy and the handles were wide enough to get a good grip on them.
customer_reviews.author: c. anderson

customer_reviews.title: Dull blades
customer_reviews.text: Though it’s sturdier than the plastic ones, the blades are not sharp. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JBC

customer_reviews.title: Does not cut the apple completely
customer_reviews.text: Had a Oxo but after years of use it broke. Got this on the Editorial's recommendation. This one though is not sharp enough, requires more effort, and does not cut all the way to the bottom of the apply. Now I'm throwing it away and buying Oxo again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Piraino

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.  Included brush helps keep it clean.  Large enough for large apples.
customer_reviews.text: Construction seems sturdy. Apple slices are narrow (12 per apple) vs 6 or 8 which is a plus for me. So far I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Not as comfortable as Oxo's rubber handled model
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Very sturdy. Cuts very well. But the handles are very sharp and not that comfortable on the hands. Good but not the best.
customer_reviews.author: Donald F. Lessnau

customer_reviews.title: Apple corer & slicer
customer_reviews.text: Takes a lot of pressure to make this work. Does not work well on smaller apples at all.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Cheap construction
customer_reviews.text: I received this slicer on January 7, 2020. Last night, May 25, 2020, as I was slicing an apple, the blades disconnected from the frame about 1/3 of the way through the apple and sliced my finger when they did. Poor construction!
customer_reviews.author: Gulf Pointe Rob

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and works!
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty and works perfectly. I had a plastic one for years and just noticed it was cracking. This is solid metal and works great!
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Davis

customer_reviews.title: Slice 'em up!
customer_reviews.text: This slicer works great! I eat apples everyday and this slicer makes cutting my apples very easy. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Nadolski

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS!!! DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: If i could pick no stars I would. Second use and as u can see it completely came apart and cut me in the process. Do not buy dangerous item. This cut could have been so much worse these edges are extremely sharp. BEWARE.
customer_reviews.author: Jamel Figgs

customer_reviews.title: This works great!
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes the apple pieces get stuck, burni just give it a shake and they fall out. Dishwasher safe! So easy to slice an apple in seconds!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy C. Newell

customer_reviews.title: Good apple slicer
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be very durable, but I have thought that in the past and they end up breaking, but so far so good. There are no grips or padding on the handles so minus a star for that. I would recommend if you are looking for a durable apple slicer.
customer_reviews.author: L_0712

customer_reviews.title: Best way to slice an apple
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t found the trick to getting it to slice all the way to the bottom of the apple - still have to pull the pieces through. May need to furnish a stand to complete the slicing.
customer_reviews.author: James F Winton

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product. Easy to clean. Easy to use. Very sharp and makes nice size pieces for kids. No problems with rust or oxidizing.
customer_reviews.author: M DeMaris

customer_reviews.title: This is the Apple slicer to have.
customer_reviews.text: It’s heavy duty and has just the right amount of slices. I really like the fact that it’s stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Cooper

product_meta.title: SAVORLIVING Apple Slicer Upgraded Version 12-Blade Extra Large Apple Corer, Stainless Steel Ultra-Sharp Apple Cutter, Pitter, Divider for Up to 4 Inches Apples (Update)
feature_bullets: ❤ Update Craft: This upgrade apple slicer has 4 welding points on each blade highly attached on the central corer ring, which means it's stronger and more durable for daily using.
❤ Easy Using: Choose apples no bigger than 4inches, aim at the core, push down the slicer to core through it, slightly twist and get rid of the core. Then you get 12 even apple slices right away!
❤ Helpful Time Saver: Suitable for most medium-size round fruits such as apple, pear, potato. No more spending so much time on cutting or slicing, save your time and effort to enjoy fruits everyday!

❤ Ideal Kitchen Gadget: You can use this apple slicer to prepare healthy apple snacks for kids at schoool or quick apple snacks for office and parties. A useful tool to prepare apples for pies or strudels.

❤ Mind the Sharp Blades: The blades are ultra sharp. Please clean it with the cleaning brush after using, also use a cloth to wipe dry or air dry to prolong the product lifespan. If for any dissatisfaction with your purchase, you can directly request a FULL REFUND or EXCHANGE.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,753 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
